quotes.quote: America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.
America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.
Only in America can someone start with nothing and achieve the American Dream. That's the greatness of this country.
America is the land of the second chance - and when the gates of the prison open, the path ahead should lead to a better life.
This nation will remain the land of the free only so long as it is the home of the brave.
America is a passionate idea or it is nothing. America is a human brotherhood or it is chaos.
America is another name for opportunity. Our whole history appears like a last effort of divine providence on behalf of the human race.
There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
We need an America with the wisdom of experience. But we must not let America grow old in spirit.
America is a tune. It must be sung together.
America is so vast that almost everything said about it is likely to be true, and the opposite is probably equally true.
America is great because it has as much diversity in geographies as it does in peoples.
America is a nation with many flaws, but hopes so vast that only the cowardly would refuse to acknowledge them.
If you take advantage of everything America has to offer, there's nothing you can't accomplish.
Only Americans can hurt America.
America is the only nation in history which, miraculously, has gone directly from barbarism to degeneration without the usual interval of civilization.
In America, through pressure of conformity, there is freedom of choice, but nothing to choose from.

America is much more than a geographical fact. It is a political and moral fact ? the first community in which men set out in principle to institutionalize freedom, responsible government, and human equality
The great social adventure of America is no longer the conquest of the wilderness but the absorption of fifty different peoples.
America is an enormous frosted cupcake in the middle of millions of starving people.
America: Where a man can say what he thinks, if he isn't afraid of his wife, his boss, his customer, his neighbors, or the government.
America is a country that doesn't know where it is going but is determined to set a speed record getting there.
America is a large friendly dog in a small room. Every time it wags its tail it knocks over a chair.
America is a vast conspiracy to make you happy.

America makes prodigious mistakes, America has colossal faults, but one thing cannot be denied: America is always on the move. She may be going to Hell, of course, but at least she isn't standing still.
America is the best half-educated country in the world.
The United States is a nation of laws: badly written and randomly enforced.
America is therefore the land of the future, where, in the ages that lie before us, the burden of the World's History shall reveal itself.
America is a young country with an old mentality.
The business of America is not business. Neither is it war. The business of america is justice and securing the blessings of liberty.
America, we are better than these last eight years. We are a better country than this.
America is just downright mean.
In America, your ancestors don't matter so much. You're just you.
America is another name for opportunity.
There is nothing wrong in America that can't be fixed with what is right in America.
America had often been discovered before Columbus, but it had always been hushed up.
I think in our desire to create a better America,we have to have civilized debate in this country and not just yelling.
It is our duty and our privilege to keep America moving forward.
It was wonderful to find America, but it would have been more wonderful to miss it.
Regarding the fitness craze: America has lost its soul; now it's trying to save its body.
America preaches integration and practices segregation.
America is too great for small dreams.
America is great because she is good. If America ceases to be good, America will cease to be great.
The major fortunes in America have been made in land.
America, thou half-brother of the world; with something good and bad of every land.
The magic of America is that we're a free and open society with a mixed population. Part of our security is our freedom.
America is the only idealistic nation in the world.
America is great, because America is free.
America is not merely a nation but a nation of nations.
America will never run... And we will always be grateful that liberty has found such brave defenders.
America is a great country, but you can't live in it for nothing.
The essential American soul is hard, isolate, stoic, and a killer. It has never yet melted.
America did not invent human rights. In a very real sense, it is the other way round. Human rights invented America.
America forms the longest and straightest bone in the earth's skeleton.
The freedom to be an individual is the essence of America.
America is a large, friendly dog in a very small room. Every time it wags its tail, it knocks over a chair.
America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
America is a nation with many flaws, but hopes so vast that only the cowardly would refuse to acknowledge them.
All great change in America begins at the dinner table.
In America, anyone can become president. That's the problem.
In the unlikely story that is America, there has never been anything false about hope.
United States: the country where liberty is a statue.
There is no America without labor, and to fleece the one is to rob the other.
The thing that impresses me the most about America is the way parents obey their children.
Anyone who believes the competitive spirit in America is dead has never been in a supermarket when the cashier opens another check-out line.
The idea of America is so wonderful because the more equal something is, the more American it is
America is a land where men govern, but women rule.
America's greatest strength, and its greatest weakness, is our belief in second chances, our belief that we can always start over, that things can be made better.
The only foes that threaten America are the enemies at home, and these are ignorance, superstition and incompetence.
America is not just a country, it's an idea.
America's one of the finest countries anyone ever stole.
By heritage and by choice, the United States of America will make that stand.
